title: Extract_outlier_frames GUI not responsive
body:
CentOS, 7
DLC 2.1.6.2.

deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames (config_path, [‘path to original videos for training’], outlieralgorithm = ‘manual’ )

1) Move slide-bar to frame of interest
1) Grab frame
2) Move slide-bar to new location
3) All labels and the frame are not in sync i.e. the labels mirroring a mouse spine are not where the mouse is - maybe the frame and label index are off-set?
4) Move slide-bar again
5) GUI freezes and is unresponsive
6) close GUI

trace back:
```
>>> deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames(config_path,['/data/DLC/movies/200312_ext_site/site_II/site_12.avi',
... '/data/DLC/movies/200312_ext_site/site_II/site_15.avi',
... '/data/DLC/movies/200312_ext_site/site_II/site_16.avi',

... '/data/DLC/movies/200312_ext_site/site_II/site_6.avi',

http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/indexing.html#ix-indexer-is-deprecated
```

In general, the GUI for extract_outlier_frames works less smooth than the extract_frames GUI e.g. the slide-bar does not respond very well (with different bar-widths) the GUI freezes from time to time. Are the two GUIs coded very differently?

I can provide the videos and files if it helps to reproduce the issue.
